44013010	said , " You are a deceiver and trickster ! You devil ! You attack anything that is right ! Will you never stop twisting the straight ways of the Lord into crooked paths ?
44013011	Listen ! The Lord’s power is set against you . You will be blind for a while , unable even to see the daylight . " At once , Bar-Jesus’ eyes were darkened , and he began to grope about for someone to lead him around by the hand .
44013012	When the governor saw what had taken place , he came to believe , for he was astonished by the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Paul and his companions sailed from Paphos to Perga in Pamphylia . John deserted them there and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	They went on from Perga and arrived at Antioch in Pisidia . On the Sabbath , they entered and found seats in the synagogue there .
44013015	After the reading of the Law and the Prophets , the synagogue leaders invited them , " Brothers , if one of you has a sermon for the people , please speak . "
44013016	Standing up , Paul gestured with his hand and said , “ Fellow Israelites and Gentile God-worshippers , please listen to me .
44013017	The God of this people Israel chose our ancestors . God made them a great people while they lived as strangers in the land of Egypt . With his great power , he led them out of that country .
44013018	For about forty years , God put up with them in the wilderness .
44013019	God conquered seven nations in the land of Canaan and gave the Israelites their land as an inheritance .
44013020	This happened over a period of about four hundred fifty years . “ After this , he gave them judges until the time of the prophet Samuel .
44013021	The Israelites requested a king , so God gave them Saul , Kish’s son , from the tribe of Benjamin , and he served as their king for forty years .
44013022	After God removed him , he raised up David to be their king . God testified concerning him , ‘ I have found David , Jesse’s son , a man who shares my desires . Whatever my will is , he will do . ’
44013023	From this man’s descendants , God brought to Israel a savior , Jesus , just as he promised .
44013024	Before Jesus’ appearance , John proclaimed to all the Israelites a baptism to show they were changing their hearts and lives .
44013025	As John was completing his mission , he said , ‘ Who do you think I am ? I’m not the one you think I am , but he is coming after me . I’m not worthy to loosen his sandals . ’
44013026	“ Brothers , children of Abraham’s family , and you Gentile God-worshippers , the message about this salvation has been sent to us .
44013027	The people in Jerusalem and their leaders didn’t recognize Jesus . By condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath .
44013028	Even though they didn’t find a single legal basis for the death penalty , they asked Pilate to have him executed .
44013029	When they finished doing everything that had been written about him , they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him from the dead !
44013031	He appeared over many days to those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem . They are now his witnesses to the people .
44013032	“ We proclaim to you the good news . What God promised to our ancestors ,
44013033	he has fulfilled for us , their children , by raising up Jesus . As it was written in the second psalm , You are my son ; today I have become your father .
44013034	“ God raised Jesus from the dead , never again to be subjected to death’s decay . Therefore , God said , I will give to you the holy and firm promises I made to David .
44013035	In another place it is said , You will not let your holy one experience death’s decay .
44013036	David served God’s purpose in his own generation , then he died and was buried with his ancestors . He experienced death’s decay ,
44013037	but the one whom God has raised up didn’t experience death’s decay .
44013038	" Therefore , brothers and sisters , know this : Through Jesus we proclaim forgiveness of sins to you . From all those sins from which you couldn’t be put in right relationship with God through Moses’ Law ,
44013039	through Jesus everyone who believes is put in right relationship with God .
44013040	Take care that the prophets’ words don’t apply to you :
44013041	Look , you scoffers , marvel and die . I’m going to do work in your day — a work you won’t believe even if someone told you . "
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue , the people urged them to speak about these things again on the next Sabbath .
44013043	When the people in the synagogue were dismissed , many Jews and devout converts to Judaism accompanied Paul and Barnabas , who urged them to remain faithful to the message of God’s grace .
44013044	On the next Sabbath , almost everyone in the city gathered to hear the Lord’s word .
44013045	When the Jews saw the crowds , they were overcome with jealousy . They argued against what Paul was saying by slandering him .
44013046	Speaking courageously , Paul and Barnabas said , " We had to speak God’s word to you first . Since you reject it and show that you are unworthy to receive eternal life , we will turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	This is what the Lord commanded us : I have made you a light for the Gentiles , so that you could bring salvation to the end of the earth . "
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they rejoiced and honored the Lord’s word . Everyone who was appointed for eternal life believed ,
44013049	and the Lord’s word was broadcast throughout the entire region .
44013050	However , the Jews provoked the prominent women among the Gentile God-worshippers , as well as the city’s leaders . They instigated others to harass Paul and Barnabas , and threw them out of their district .
44013051	Paul and Barnabas shook the dust from their feet and went to Iconium .
44013052	Because of the abundant presence of the Holy Spirit in their lives , the disciples were overflowing with happiness .
44014001	The same thing happened in Iconium . Paul and Barnabas entered the Jewish synagogue and spoke as they had before . As a result , a huge number of Jews and Greeks believed .
44014002	However , the Jews who rejected the faith stirred up the Gentiles , poisoning their minds against the brothers .
44014003	Nevertheless , Paul and Barnabas stayed there for quite some time , confidently speaking about the Lord . And the Lord confirmed the word about his grace by the signs and wonders he enabled them to perform .
44014004	The people of the city were divided — some siding with the Jews , others with the Lord’s messengers .
44014005	Then some Gentiles and Jews , including their leaders , hatched a plot to mistreat and stone Paul and Barnabas .
44014006	When they learned of it , these two messengers fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding area ,
44014007	where they continued to proclaim the good news .
44014008	In Lystra there was a certain man who lacked strength in his legs . He had been crippled since birth and had never walked . Sitting there , he
44014009	heard Paul speaking . Paul stared at him and saw that he believed he could be healed .
44014010	Raising his voice , Paul said , " Stand up straight on your feet ! " He jumped up and began to walk .
44014011	Seeing what Paul had done , the crowd shouted in the Lycaonian language , " The gods have taken human form and come down to visit us ! "
44014012	They referred to Barnabas as Zeus and to Paul as Hermes , since Paul was the main speaker .
44014013	The priest of Zeus , whose temple was located just outside the city , brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates . Along with the crowds , he wanted to offer sacrifices to them .
44014014	When the Lord’s messengers Barnabas and Paul found out about this , they tore their clothes in protest and rushed out into the crowd . They shouted ,
44014015	" People , what are you doing ? We are humans too , just like you ! We are proclaiming the good news to you : turn to the living God and away from such worthless things . He made the heaven , the earth , the sea , and everything in them .
44014016	In the past , he permitted every nation to go its own way .
44014017	Nevertheless , he hasn’t left himself without a witness . He has blessed you by giving you rain from above as well as seasonal harvests , and satisfying you with food and happiness . "
44014018	Even with these words , they barely kept the crowds from sacrificing to them .
44014019	Jews from Antioch and Iconium arrived and won the crowds over . They stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city , supposing he was dead .
44014020	When the disciples surrounded him , he got up and entered the city again . The following day he left with Barnabas for Derbe .
44014021	Paul and Barnabas proclaimed the good news to the people in Derbe and made many disciples . Then they returned to Lystra , Iconium , and Antioch , where
44014022	they strengthened the disciples and urged them to remain firm in the faith . They told them , " If we are to enter God’s kingdom , we must pass through many troubles . "
44014023	They appointed elders for each church . With prayer and fasting , they committed these elders to the Lord , in whom they had placed their trust .
44014024	After Paul and Barnabas traveled through Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
44014025	They proclaimed the word in Perga , then went down to Attalia .
44014026	From there they sailed to Antioch , where they had been entrusted by God’s grace to the work they had now completed .
44014027	On their arrival , they gathered the church together and reported everything that God had accomplished through their activity , and how God had opened a door of faith for the Gentiles .
44014028	They stayed with the disciples a long time .
44015001	Some people came down from Judea teaching the family of believers , " Unless you are circumcised according to the custom we’ve received from Moses , you can’t be saved . "
44015002	Paul and Barnabas took sides against these Judeans and argued strongly against their position . The church at Antioch appointed Paul , Barnabas , and several others from Antioch to go up to Jerusalem to set this question before the apostles and the elders .
44015003	The church sent this delegation on their way . They traveled through Phoenicia and Samaria , telling stories about the conversion of the Gentiles to everyone . Their reports thrilled the brothers and sisters .
44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , the church , the apostles , and the elders all welcomed them . They gave a full report of what God had accomplished through their activity .
44015005	Some believers from among the Pharisees stood up and claimed , " The Gentiles must be circumcised . They must be required to keep the Law from Moses . "
44015006	The apostles and the elders gathered to consider this matter .
44015007	After much debate , Peter stood and addressed them , " Fellow believers , you know that , early on , God chose me from among you as the one through whom the Gentiles would hear the word of the gospel and come to believe .
44015008	God , who knows people’s deepest thoughts and desires , confirmed this by giving them the Holy Spirit , just as he did to us .
44015009	He made no distinction between us and them , but purified their deepest thoughts and desires through faith .
44015010	Why then are you now challenging God by placing a burden on the shoulders of these disciples that neither we nor our ancestors could bear ?
44015011	On the contrary , we believe that we and they are saved in the same way , by the grace of the Lord Jesus . "
44015012	The entire assembly fell quiet as they listened to Barnabas and Paul describe all the signs and wonders God did among the Gentiles through their activity .
44015013	When Barnabas and Paul also fell silent , James responded , “ Fellow believers , listen to me .
44015014	Simon reported how , in his kindness , God came to the Gentiles in the first place , to raise up from them a people of God .
44015015	The prophets’ words agree with this ; as it is written ,
44015016	After this I will return , The Lord says this , the one who does these things
44015018	known from earliest times .
44015019	" Therefore , I conclude that we shouldn’t create problems for Gentiles who turn to God .
44015020	Instead , we should write a letter , telling them to avoid the pollution associated with idols , sexual immorality , eating meat from strangled animals , and consuming blood .
44015021	After all , Moses has been proclaimed in every city for a long time , and is read aloud every Sabbath in every synagogue . "
44015022	The apostles and the elders , along with the entire church , agreed to send some delegates chosen from among themselves to Antioch , together with Paul and Barnabas . They selected Judas Barsabbas and Silas , who were leaders among the brothers and sisters .
44015023	They were to carry this letter : The apostles and the elders , to the Gentile brothers and sisters in Antioch , Syria , and Cilicia . Greetings !
44015024	We’ve heard that some of our number have disturbed you with unsettling words we didn’t authorize .
44015025	We reached a united decision to select some delegates and send them to you along with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul .
44015026	These people have devoted their lives to the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	Therefore , we are sending Judas and Silas . They will confirm what we have written .
44015028	The Holy Spirit has led us to the decision that no burden should be placed on you other than these essentials :
44015029	refuse food offered to idols , blood , the meat from strangled animals , and sexual immorality . You will do well to avoid such things . Farewell .
44015030	When Barnabas , Paul , and the delegates were sent on their way , they went down to Antioch . They gathered the believers and delivered the letter .
44015031	The people read it , delighted with its encouraging message .
44015032	Judas and Silas were prophets , and they said many things that encouraged and strengthened the brothers and sisters .
44015033	Judas and Silas stayed there awhile , then were sent back with a blessing of peace from the brothers and sisters to those who first sent them .
44015035	Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch , where , together with many others , they taught and proclaimed the good news of the Lord’s word .
44015036	Some time later , Paul said to Barnabas , " Let’s go back and visit all the brothers and sisters in every city where we preached the Lord’s word . Let’s see how they are doing . "
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John Mark with them .
44015038	Paul insisted that they shouldn’t take him along , since he had deserted them in Pamphylia and hadn’t continued with them in their work .
44015039	Their argument became so intense that they went their separate ways . Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus .
44015040	Paul chose Silas and left , entrusted by the brothers and sisters to the Lord’s grace .
44015041	He traveled through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches .
44016001	Paul reached Derbe , and then Lystra , where there was a disciple named Timothy . He was the son of a believing Jewish woman and a Greek father .
44016002	The brothers and sisters in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him .
44016003	Paul wanted to take Timothy with him , so he circumcised him . This was because of the Jews who lived in those areas , for they all knew Timothy’s father was Greek .
44016004	As Paul and his companions traveled through the cities , they instructed Gentile believers to keep the regulations put in place by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem .
44016005	So the churches were strengthened in the faith and every day their numbers flourished .
44016006	Paul and his companions traveled throughout the regions of Phrygia and Galatia because the Holy Spirit kept them from speaking the word in the province of Asia .
44016007	When they approached the province of Mysia , they tried to enter the province of Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus wouldn’t let them .
44016008	Passing by Mysia , they went down to Troas instead .
44016009	A vision of a man from Macedonia came to Paul during the night . He stood urging Paul , " Come over to Macedonia and help us ! "
44016010	Immediately after he saw the vision , we prepared to leave for the province of Macedonia , concluding that God had called us to proclaim the good news to them .
44016011	We sailed from Troas straight for Samothrace and came to Neapolis the following day .
44016012	From there we went to Philippi , a city of Macedonia’s first district and a Roman colony . We stayed in that city several days .
44016013	On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate to the riverbank , where we thought there might be a place for prayer . We sat down and began to talk with the women who had gathered .
44016014	One of those women was Lydia , a Gentile God-worshipper from the city of Thyatira , a dealer in purple cloth . As she listened , the Lord enabled her to embrace Paul’s message .
44016015	Once she and her household were baptized , she urged , " Now that you have decided that I am a believer in the Lord , come and stay in my house . " And she persuaded us .
44016016	One day , when we were on the way to the place for prayer , we met a slave woman . She had a spirit that enabled her to predict the future . She made a lot of money for her owners through fortune-telling .
44016017	She began following Paul and us , shouting , " These people are servants of the Most High God ! They are proclaiming a way of salvation to you ! "
44016018	She did this for many days . This annoyed Paul so much that he finally turned and said to the spirit , " In the name of Jesus Christ , I command you to leave her ! " It left her at that very moment .
44016019	Her owners realized that their hope for making money was gone . They grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them before the officials in the city center .
44016020	When her owners approached the legal authorities , they said , " These people are causing an uproar in our city . They are Jews
44016021	who promote customs that we Romans can’t accept or practice . "
44016022	The crowd joined in the attacks against Paul and Silas , so the authorities ordered that they be stripped of their clothes and beaten with a rod .
44016023	When Paul and Silas had been severely beaten , the authorities threw them into prison and ordered the jailer to secure them with great care .
44016024	When he received these instructions , he threw them into the innermost cell and secured their feet in stocks .
44016025	Around midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the other prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	All at once there was such a violent earthquake that it shook the prison’s foundations . The doors flew open and everyone’s chains came loose .
44016027	When the jailer awoke and saw the open doors of the prison , he thought the prisoners had escaped , so he drew his sword and was about to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted loudly , " Don’t harm yourself ! We’re all here ! "
44016029	The jailer called for some lights , rushed in , and fell trembling before Paul and Silas .
44016030	He led them outside and asked , " Honorable masters , what must I do to be rescued ? "
44016031	They replied , " Believe in the Lord Jesus , and you will be saved — you and your entire household . "
44016032	They spoke the Lord’s word to him and everyone else in his house .
44016033	Right then , in the middle of the night , the jailer welcomed them and washed their wounds . He and everyone in his household were immediately baptized .
44016034	He brought them into his home and gave them a meal . He was overjoyed because he and everyone in his household had come to believe in God .
44016035	The next morning the legal authorities sent the police to the jailer with the order " Release those people . "
44016036	So the jailer reported this to Paul , informing him , " The authorities sent word that you both are to be released . You can leave now . Go in peace . "
44016037	Paul told the police , " Even though we are Roman citizens , they beat us publicly without first finding us guilty of a crime , and they threw us into prison . And now they want to send us away secretly ? No way ! They themselves will have to come and escort us out . "
44016038	The police reported this to the legal authorities , who were alarmed to learn that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens .
44016039	They came and consoled Paul and Silas , escorting them out of prison and begging them to leave the city .
44016040	Paul and Silas left the prison and made their way to Lydia’s house where they encouraged the brothers and sisters . Then they left Philippi .
44017001	Paul and Silas journeyed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , then came to Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	As was Paul’s custom , he entered the synagogue and for three Sabbaths interacted with them on the basis of the scriptures .
44017003	Through his interpretation of the scriptures , he demonstrated that the Christ had to suffer and rise from the dead . He declared , " This Jesus whom I proclaim to you is the Christ . "
44017004	Some were convinced and joined Paul and Silas , including a larger number of Greek God-worshippers and quite a few prominent women .
44017005	But the Jews became jealous and brought along some thugs who were hanging out in the marketplace . They formed a mob and started a riot in the city . They attacked Jason’s house , intending to bring Paul and Silas before the people .
44017006	When they didn’t find them , they dragged Jason and some believers before the city officials . They were shouting , " These people who have been disturbing the peace throughout the empire have also come here .
44017007	What is more , Jason has welcomed them into his home . Every one of them does what is contrary to Caesar’s decrees by naming someone else as king : Jesus . "
44017008	This provoked the crowd and the city officials even more .
44017009	After Jason and the others posted bail , they released them .
44017010	As soon as it was dark , the brothers and sisters sent Paul and Silas on to Beroea . When they arrived , they went to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	The Beroean Jews were more honorable than those in Thessalonica . This was evident in the great eagerness with which they accepted the word and examined the scriptures each day to see whether Paul and Silas’ teaching was true .
44017012	Many came to believe , including a number of reputable Greek women and many Greek men .
44017013	The Jews from Thessalonica learned that Paul also proclaimed God’s word in Beroea , so they went there too and were upsetting and disturbing the crowds .
44017014	The brothers and sisters sent Paul away to the seacoast at once , but Silas and Timothy remained at Beroea .
44017015	Those who escorted Paul led him as far as Athens , then returned with instructions for Silas and Timothy to come to him as quickly as possible .
44017016	While Paul waited for them in Athens , he was deeply distressed to find that the city was flooded with idols .
44017017	He began to interact with the Jews and Gentile God-worshippers in the synagogue . He also addressed whoever happened to be in the marketplace each day .
44017018	Certain Epicurean and Stoic philosophers engaged him in discussion too . Some said , " What an amateur ! What’s he trying to say ? " Others remarked , " He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods . " ( They said this because he was preaching the good news about Jesus and the resurrection . )
44017019	They took him into custody and brought him to the council on Mars Hill . " What is this new teaching ? Can we learn what you are talking about ?
44017020	You’ve told us some strange things and we want to know what they mean . " (
44017021	They said this because all Athenians as well as the foreigners who live in Athens used to spend their time doing nothing but talking about or listening to the newest thing . )
44017022	Paul stood up in the middle of the council on Mars Hill and said , “ People of Athens , I see that you are very religious in every way .
44017023	As I was walking through town and carefully observing your objects of worship , I even found an altar with this inscription : ‘ To an unknown God . ’ What you worship as unknown , I now proclaim to you .
44017024	God , who made the world and everything in it , is Lord of heaven and earth . He doesn’t live in temples made with human hands .
44017025	Nor is God served by human hands , as though he needed something , since he is the one who gives life , breath , and everything else .
44017026	From one person God created every human nation to live on the whole earth , having determined their appointed times and the boundaries of their lands .
44017027	God made the nations so they would seek him , perhaps even reach out to him and find him . In fact , God isn’t far away from any of us .
44017028	In God we live , move , and exist . As some of your own poets said , ‘ We are his offspring . ’
44017029	" Therefore , as God’s offspring , we have no need to imagine that the divine being is like a gold , silver , or stone image made by human skill and thought .
44017030	God overlooks ignorance of these things in times past , but now directs everyone everywhere to change their hearts and lives .
44017031	This is because God has set a day when he intends to judge the world justly by a man he has appointed . God has given proof of this to everyone by raising him from the dead . "
44017032	When they heard about the resurrection from the dead , some began to ridicule Paul . However , others said , " We’ll hear from you about this again . "
44017033	At that , Paul left the council .
44017034	Some people joined him and came to believe , including Dionysius , a member of the council on Mars Hill , a woman named Damaris , and several others .
44018001	After this , Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he found a Jew named Aquila , a native of Pontus . He had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla because Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome . Paul visited with them .
44018003	Because they practiced the same trade , he stayed and worked with them . They all worked with leather .
44018004	Every Sabbath he interacted with people in the synagogue , trying to convince both Jews and Greeks .
44018005	Once Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia , Paul devoted himself fully to the word , testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ .
44018006	When they opposed and slandered him , he shook the dust from his clothes in protest and said to them , " You are responsible for your own fates ! I’m innocent ! From now on I’ll go to the Gentiles ! "
44018007	He left the synagogue and went next door to the home of Titius Justus , a Gentile God-worshipper .
44018008	Crispus , the synagogue leader , and his entire household came to believe in the Lord . Many Corinthians believed and were baptized after listening to Paul .
44018009	One night the Lord said to Paul in a vision , " Don’t be afraid . Continue speaking . Don’t be silent .
44018010	I’m with you and no one who attacks you will harm you , for I have many people in this city . "
44018011	So he stayed there for eighteen months , teaching God’s word among them .
44018012	Now when Gallio was the governor of the province of Achaia , the Jews united in their opposition against Paul and brought him before the court .
44018013	" This man is persuading others to worship God unlawfully , " they declared .
44018014	Just as Paul was about to speak , Gallio said to the Jews , " If there had been some sort of injury or criminal behavior , I would have reason to accept your complaint .
44018015	However , since these are squabbles about a message , names , and your own Law , deal with them yourselves . I have no desire to sit in judgment over such things . "
44018016	He expelled them from the court ,
44018017	but everyone seized Sosthenes , the synagogue leader , and gave him a beating in the presence of the governor . None of this mattered to Gallio .
44018018	After Paul stayed in Corinth for some time , he said good-bye to the brothers and sisters . At the Corinthian seaport of Cenchreae he had his head shaved , since he had made a solemn promise . Then , accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila , he sailed away to Syria .
44018019	After they arrived in Ephesus , he left Priscilla and Aquila and entered the synagogue and interacted with the Jews .
44018020	They asked him to stay longer , but he declined .
44018021	As he said farewell to them , though , he added , " God willing , I will return . " Then he sailed off from Ephesus .
44018022	He arrived in Caesarea , went up to Jerusalem and greeted the church , and then went down to Antioch .
44018023	After some time there he left and traveled from place to place in the region of Galatia and the district of Phrygia , strengthening all the disciples .
44018024	Meanwhile , a certain Jew named Apollos arrived in Ephesus . He was a native of Alexandria and was well-educated and effective in his use of the scriptures .
44018025	He had been instructed in the way of the Lord and spoke as one stirred up by the Spirit . He taught accurately the things about Jesus , even though he was aware only of the baptism John proclaimed and practiced .
44018026	He began speaking with confidence in the synagogue . When Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they received him into their circle of friends and explained to him God’s way more accurately .
44018027	When he wanted to travel to Achaia , the brothers and sisters encouraged him and wrote to the disciples so they would open their homes to him . Once he arrived , he was of great help to those who had come to believe through grace .
44018028	He would vigorously defeat Jewish arguments in public debate , using the scriptures to prove that Jesus was the Christ .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul took a route through the interior and came to Ephesus , where he found some disciples .
44019002	He asked them , " Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you came to believe ? " They replied , " We’ve not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . "
44019003	Then he said , " What baptism did you receive , then ? " They answered , " John’s baptism . "
44019004	Paul explained , " John baptized with a baptism by which people showed they were changing their hearts and lives . It was a baptism that told people about the one who was coming after him . This is the one in whom they were to believe . This one is Jesus . "
44019005	After they listened to Paul , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	When Paul placed his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came on them , and they began speaking in other languages and prophesying .
44019007	Altogether , there were about twelve people .
44019008	Paul went to the synagogue and spoke confidently for the next three months . He interacted with those present and offered convincing arguments concerning the nature of God’s kingdom .
44019009	Some people had closed their minds , though . They refused to believe and publicly slandered the Way . As a result , Paul left them , took the disciples with him , and continued his daily interactions in Tyrannus’ lecture hall .
44019010	This went on for two years , so that everyone living in the province of Asia — both Jews and Greeks — heard the Lord’s word .
44019011	God was doing unusual miracles through Paul .
44019012	Even the small towels and aprons that had touched his skin were taken to the sick , and their diseases were cured and the evil spirits left them .
44019013	There were some Jews who traveled around throwing out evil spirits . They tried to use the power of the name of the Lord Jesus against some people with evil spirits . They said , " In the name of the Jesus whom Paul preaches , I command you ! "
44019014	The seven sons of Sceva , a Jewish chief priest , were doing this .
44019015	The evil spirit replied , " I know Jesus and I’m familiar with Paul , but who are you ? "
44019016	The person who had an evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all with such force that they ran out of that house naked and wounded .
44019017	This became known to the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus . Everyone was seized with fear and they held the name of the Lord Jesus in the highest regard .
44019018	Many of those who had come to believe came , confessing their past practices .
44019019	This included a number of people who practiced sorcery . They collected their sorcery texts and burned them publicly . The value of those materials was calculated at more than someone might make if they worked for one hundred sixty-five years .
44019020	In this way the Lord’s word grew abundantly and strengthened powerfully .
44019021	Once these things had come to an end , Paul , guided by the Spirit , decided to return to Jerusalem , taking a route that would carry him through the provinces of Macedonia and Achaia . He said , " After I have been there , I must visit Rome as well . "
44019022	He sent two of his assistants , Timothy and Erastus , to Macedonia , while he remained awhile in the province of Asia .
44019023	At that time a great disturbance erupted about the Way .
44019024	There was a silversmith named Demetrius . He made silver models of Artemis’ temple , and his business generated a lot of profit for the craftspeople .
44019025	He called a meeting with these craftspeople and others working in related trades and said , " Friends , you know that we make an easy living from this business .
44019026	And you can see and hear that this Paul has convinced and misled a lot of people , not only in Ephesus but also throughout most of the province of Asia . He says that gods made by human hands aren’t really gods .
44019027	This poses a danger not only by discrediting our trade but also by completely dishonoring the great goddess Artemis . The whole province of Asia — indeed , the entire civilized world — worships her , but her splendor will soon be extinguished . "
44019028	Once they heard this , they were beside themselves with anger and began to shout , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019029	The city was thrown into turmoil . They rushed as one into the theater . They seized Gaius and Aristarchus , Paul’s traveling companions from the province of Macedonia .
44019030	Paul wanted to appear before the assembly , but the disciples wouldn’t allow him .
44019031	Even some officials of the province of Asia , who were Paul’s friends , sent word to him , urging him not to risk going into the theater .
44019032	Meanwhile , the assembly was in a state of confusion . Some shouted one thing , others shouted something else , and most of the crowd didn’t know why they had gathered .
44019033	The Jews sent Alexander to the front , and some of the crowd directed their words toward him . He gestured that he wanted to offer a defense before the assembly ,
44019034	but when they realized he was a Jew , they all shouted in unison , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! " This continued for about two hours .
44019035	The city manager brought order to the crowd and said , " People of Ephesus , doesn’t everyone know that the city of Ephesus is guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image , which fell from heaven ?
44019036	Therefore , since these facts are undeniable , you must calm down . Don’t be reckless .
44019037	The men you brought here have neither robbed the temple nor slandered our goddess .
44019038	Therefore , if Demetrius and the craftspeople with him have a charge against anyone , the courts are in session and governors are available . They can press charges against each other there .
44019039	Additional disputes can be resolved in a legal assembly .
44019040	As for us , we are in danger of being charged with rioting today , since we can’t justify this unruly gathering . "
44019041	After he said this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	When the riot was over , Paul sent for the disciples , encouraged them , said good-bye , and left for the province of Macedonia .
44020002	He traveled through that region with a message of encouragement . When he came to Greece ,
44020003	he stayed for three months . Because the Jews hatched a plot against Paul as he was about to sail for Syria , he decided instead to return through Macedonia .
44020004	He was accompanied by Sopater , Pyrrhus’ son from Beroea , Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica , Gaius from Derbe , Timothy , and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia .
44020005	They went on ahead and waited for us in Troas .
44020006	We sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread and met them five days later in Troas , where we stayed for a week .
44020007	On the first day of the week , as we gathered together for a meal , Paul was holding a discussion with them . Since he was leaving the next day , he continued talking until midnight .
44020008	There were many lamps in the upstairs room where we had gathered .
44020009	A young man named Eutychus was sitting in the window . He was sinking into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on . When he was sound asleep , he fell from the third floor and died .
44020010	Paul went down , fell on him and embraced him , then said , " Don’t be alarmed . He’s alive ! "
44020011	Then Paul went back upstairs and ate . He talked for a long time — right up until daybreak — then he left .
44020012	They took the young man away alive , and they were greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on to the ship and sailed for Assos , where we intended to take Paul on board . Paul had arranged this , since he intended to make his way there by land .
44020014	When he met us at Assos , we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene .
44020015	The next day we sailed from there and arrived opposite Chios . On the day after , we sailed to Samos , and on the following day we came to Miletus .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so that he wouldn’t need to spend too much time in the province of Asia . He was hurrying to reach Jerusalem , if possible , by Pentecost Day .
44020017	From Miletus he sent a message to Ephesus calling for the church’s elders to meet him .
44020018	When they arrived , he said to them , “ You know how I lived among you the whole time I was with you , beginning with the first day I arrived in the province of Asia .
44020019	I served the Lord with great humility and with tears in the midst of trials that came upon me because of the Jews’ schemes .
44020020	You know I held back nothing that would be helpful so that I could proclaim to you and teach you both publicly and privately in your homes .
44020021	You know I have testified to both Jews and Greeks that they must change their hearts and lives as they turn to God and have faith in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	Now , compelled by the Spirit , I’m going to Jerusalem . I don’t know what will happen to me there .
44020023	What I do know is that the Holy Spirit testifies to me from city to city that prisons and troubles await me .
44020024	But nothing , not even my life , is more important than my completing my mission . This is nothing other than the ministry I received from the Lord Jesus : to testify about the good news of God’s grace .
44020025	" I know that none of you will see me again — you among whom I traveled and proclaimed the kingdom .
44020026	Therefore , today I testify to you that I’m not responsible for anyone’s fate .
44020027	I haven’t avoided proclaiming the entire plan of God to you .
44020028	Watch yourselves and the whole flock , in which the Holy Spirit has placed you as supervisors , to shepherd God’s church , which he obtained with the death of his own Son .
44020029	I know that , after my departure , savage wolves will come in among you and won’t spare the flock .
44020030	Some of your own people will distort the word in order to lure followers after them .
44020031	Stay alert ! Remember that for three years I constantly and tearfully warned each one of you . I never stopped warning you !
44020032	Now I entrust you to God and the message of his grace , which is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all whom God has made holy .
44020033	I haven’t craved anyone’s silver , gold , or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that I have provided for my own needs and for those of my companions with my own hands .
44020035	In everything I have shown you that , by working hard , we must help the weak . In this way we remember the Lord Jesus’ words : ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ "
44020036	After he said these things , he knelt down with all of them to pray .
44020037	They cried uncontrollably as everyone embraced and kissed Paul .
44020038	They were especially grieved by his statement that they would never see him again . Then they accompanied him to the ship .
44021001	After we tore ourselves away from them , we set sail on a straight course to Cos , reaching Rhodes the next day , and then Patara .
44021002	We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia , boarded , and put out to sea .
44021003	We spotted Cyprus , but passed by it on our left . We sailed on to the province of Syria and landed in Tyre , where the ship was to unload its cargo .
44021004	We found the disciples there and stayed with them for a week . Compelled by the Spirit , they kept telling Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021005	When our time had come to an end , we departed . All of them , including women and children , accompanied us out of town where we knelt on the beach and prayed .
44021006	We said good-bye to each other , then we boarded the ship and they returned to their homes .
44021007	Continuing our voyage , we sailed from Tyre and arrived in Ptolemais . We greeted the brothers and sisters there and spent a day with them .
44021008	The next day we left and came to Caesarea . We went to the house of Philip the evangelist , one of the Seven , and stayed with him .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who were involved in the work of prophecy .
44021010	After staying there for several days , a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea .
44021011	He came to us , took Paul’s belt , tied his own feet and hands , and said , " This is what the Holy Spirit says : ‘ In Jerusalem the Jews will bind the man who owns this belt , and they will hand him over to the Gentiles . ’ "
44021012	When we heard this , we and the local believers urged Paul not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Paul replied , " Why are you doing this ? Why are you weeping and breaking my heart ? I’m ready not only to be arrested but even to die in Jerusalem for the sake of the name of the Lord Jesus . "
44021014	Since we couldn’t talk him out of it , the only thing we could say was , " The Lord’s will be done . "
44021015	After this , we got ready and made our way up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea accompanied us and led us to Mnason’s home , where we were guests . He was from Cyprus and had been a disciple a long time .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the brothers and sisters welcomed us warmly .
44021018	On the next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James . All of the elders were present .
44021019	After greeting them , he gave them a detailed report of what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	Those who heard this praised God . Then they said to him , " Brother , you see how many thousands of Jews have become believers , and all of them keep the Law passionately .
44021021	They have been informed that you teach all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to reject Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children nor to live according to our customs .
44021022	What about this ? Without a doubt , they will hear that you have arrived .
44021023	You must therefore do what we tell you . Four men among us have made a solemn promise .
44021024	Take them with you , go through the purification ritual with them , and pay the cost of having their heads shaved . Everyone will know there is nothing to those reports about you but that you too live a life in keeping with the Law .
44021025	As for the Gentile believers , we wrote a letter about what we decided , that they avoid food offered to idols , blood , the meat from strangled animals , and sexual immorality . "
44021026	The following day Paul took the men with him and went through the purification ritual with them . He entered the temple and publicly announced the completion of the days of purification , when the offering would be presented for each one of them .
44021027	When the seven days of purification were almost over , the Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul in the temple . Grabbing him , they threw the whole crowd into confusion by shouting ,
44021028	" Fellow Israelites ! Help ! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people , the Law , and this place . Not only that , he has even brought Greeks into the temple and defiled this holy place . " (
44021029	They said this because they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him earlier , and they assumed Paul had brought him into the temple . )
44021030	The entire city was stirred up . The people came rushing , seized Paul , and dragged him out of the temple . Immediately the gates were closed .
44021031	While they were trying to kill him , a report reached the commander of a company of soldiers that all Jerusalem was in a state of confusion .
44021032	Without a moment’s hesitation , he took some soldiers and officers and ran down to the mob . When the mob saw the commander and his soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	When the commander arrived , he arrested Paul and ordered him to be bound with two chains . Only then did he begin to ask who Paul was and what he had done .
44021034	Some in the crowd shouted one thing , others shouted something else . Because of the commotion , he couldn’t learn the truth , so he ordered that Paul be taken to the military headquarters .
44021035	When Paul reached the steps , he had to be carried by the soldiers in order to protect him from the violence of the crowd .
44021036	The mob that followed kept screaming , " Away with him ! "
44021037	As Paul was about to be taken into the military headquarters , he asked the commander , " May I speak with you ? " He answered , " Do you know Greek ?
44021038	Aren’t you the Egyptian who started a revolt and led four thousand terrorists into the desert some time ago ? "
44021039	Paul replied , " I’m a Jew from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of an important city . Please , let me speak to the people . "
44021040	With the commander’s permission , Paul stood on the steps and gestured to the people . When they were quiet , he addressed them in Aramaic .
44022001	" Brothers and fathers , listen now to my defense . "
44022002	When they heard him address them in Aramaic , they became even more quiet .
44022003	Paul continued , “ I’m a Jew , born in Tarsus in Cilicia but raised in this city . Under Gamaliel’s instruction , I was trained in the strict interpretation of our ancestral Law . I am passionately loyal to God , just like you who are gathered here today .
44022004	I harassed those who followed this Way to their death , arresting and delivering both men and women into prison .
44022005	The high priest and the whole Jerusalem Council can testify about me . I received letters from them , addressed to our associates in Damascus , then went there to bring those who were arrested to Jerusalem so they could be punished .
44022006	“ During that journey , about noon , as I approached Damascus , suddenly a bright light from heaven encircled me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice asking me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you harassing me ? ’
44022008	I answered , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ ‘ I am Jesus the Nazarene , whom you are harassing , ’ he replied .
44022009	My traveling companions saw the light , but they didn’t hear the voice of the one who spoke to me .
44022010	I asked , ‘ What should I do , Lord ? ’ ‘ Get up , ’ the Lord replied , ‘ and go into Damascus . There you will be told everything you have been appointed to do . ’
44022011	I couldn’t see because of the brightness of that light , so my companions led me by the hand into Damascus .
44022012	“ There was a certain man named Ananias . According to the standards of the Law , he was a pious man who enjoyed the respect of all the Jews living there .
44022013	He came and stood beside me . ‘ Brother Saul , receive your sight ! ’ he said . Instantly , I regained my sight and I could see him .
44022014	He said , ‘ The God of our ancestors has selected you to know his will , to see the righteous one , and to hear his voice .
44022015	You will be his witness to everyone concerning what you have seen and heard .
44022016	What are you waiting for ? Get up , be baptized , and wash away your sins as you call on his name . ’
44022017	" When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple , I had a visionary experience .
44022018	I saw the Lord speaking to me . ‘ Hurry ! ’ he said . ‘ Leave Jerusalem at once because they won’t accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	I responded , ‘ Lord , these people know I used to go from one synagogue to the next , beating those who believe in you and throwing them into prison .
44022020	When Stephen your witness was being killed , I stood there giving my approval , even watching the clothes that belonged to those who were killing him . ’
44022021	Then the Lord said to me , ‘ Go ! I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ’ "
44022022	The crowd listened to Paul until he said this . Then they shouted , " Away with this man ! He’s not fit to live ! "
44022023	As they were screaming , throwing off their garments , and flinging dust into the air ,
44022024	the commander directed that Paul be taken into the military headquarters . He ordered that Paul be questioned under the whip so that he could find out why they were shouting at him like this .
44022025	As they were stretching him out and tying him down with straps , Paul said to the centurion standing there , " Can you legally whip a Roman citizen who hasn’t been found guilty in court ? "
44022026	When the centurion heard this , he went to the commander and reported it . He asked , " What are you about to do ? This man is a Roman citizen ! "
44022027	The commander went to Paul and demanded , " Tell me ! Are you a Roman citizen ? " He said , " Yes . "
44022028	The commander replied , " It cost me a lot of money to buy my citizenship . " Paul said , " I’m a citizen by birth . "
44022029	At once those who were about to examine him stepped away . The commander was alarmed when he realized he had bound a Roman citizen .
44022030	The commander still wanted to know the truth about why Paul was being accused by the Jews . Therefore , the next day he ordered the chief priests and the entire Jerusalem Council to assemble . Then he took Paul out of prison and had him stand before them .
44023001	Paul stared at the council and said , " Brothers , I have lived my life with an altogether clear conscience right up to this very day . "
44023002	The high priest Ananias ordered those standing beside Paul to strike him in the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , " God is about to strike you , you whitewashed wall ! You sit and judge me according to the Law , yet disobey the Law by ordering that I be struck . "
44023004	Those standing near him asked , " You dare to insult God’s high priest ? "
44023005	Paul replied , " Brothers , I wasn’t aware that he was the high priest . It is written , You will not speak evil about a ruler of your people . "
44023006	Knowing that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees , Paul exclaimed in the council , " Brothers , I’m a Pharisee and a descendant of Pharisees . I am on trial because of my hope in the resurrection of the dead ! "
44023007	These words aroused a dispute between the Pharisees and Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	This is because Sadducees say that there’s no resurrection , angel , or spirit , but Pharisees affirm them all .
44023009	Council members were shouting loudly . Some Pharisees who were legal experts stood up and insisted forcefully , " We find nothing wrong with this man ! What if a spirit or angel has spoken to him ? "
44023010	The dispute became so heated that the commander feared they might tear Paul to pieces . He ordered soldiers to go down and remove him by force from their midst . Then they took him back to the military headquarters .
44023011	The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said , " Be encouraged ! Just as you have testified about me in Jerusalem , so too you must testify in Rome . "
44023012	The next morning some Jewish leaders formulated a plot and solemnly promised that they wouldn’t eat or drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	More than forty people were involved in the conspiracy .
44023014	They went to the chief priests and elders and said , " We have solemnly promised to eat nothing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	You and the council must explain to the commander that you need Paul brought down to you . Pretend that you want to examine his case more closely . We’re prepared to kill him before he arrives . "
44023016	Paul’s sister had a son who heard about the ambush and he came to the military headquarters and reported it to Paul .
44023017	Paul called for one of the centurions and said , " Take this young man to the commander because he has something to report to him . "
44023018	He took him to the commander and said , " The prisoner Paul asked me to bring this young man to you . He has something to tell you . "
44023019	The commander took him by the hand and withdrew to a place where they could speak privately . He asked , " What do you have to report to me ? "
44023020	He replied , " The Jewish leaders have conspired to ask that you bring Paul down to the council tomorrow . They will pretend that they want to investigate his case more closely .
44023021	Don’t fall for it ! More than forty of them are waiting to ambush him . They have solemnly promised not to eat or drink until they have killed him . They are ready now , awaiting your consent . "
44023022	The commander dismissed the young man , ordering him , " Don’t tell anyone that you brought this to my attention . "
44023023	The commander called two centurions and said , " Prepare two hundred soldiers , seventy horsemen , and two hundred spearmen to leave for Caesarea at nine o’clock tonight .
44023024	Have horses ready for Paul to ride , so they may take him safely to Governor Felix . "
44023025	He wrote the following letter :
44023026	Claudius Lysias , to the most honorable Governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	This man was seized by the Jews and was almost killed by them . I was nearby with a unit of soldiers , and I rescued him when I discovered that he was a Roman citizen .
44023028	I wanted to find out why they were accusing him , so I brought him to their council .
44023029	I discovered that they were accusing him about questions related to their Law . I found no charge deserving of death or imprisonment .
44023030	When I was informed of a conspiracy against his life , I sent him to you at once and ordered his accusers to bring their case against him before you .
44023031	Following their orders , the soldiers took Paul during the night and brought him to Antipatris .
44023032	The following day they let the horsemen continue on with Paul while they returned to the military headquarters in Jerusalem .
44023033	The horsemen entered Caesarea , delivered the letter to the governor , and brought Paul before him .
44023034	After he read the letter , he asked Paul about his home province . When he learned that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	the governor said , " I will hear your case when your accusers arrive . " Then he ordered that Paul be kept in custody in Herod’s palace .
44024001	Five days later the high priest Ananias came down with some elders and a lawyer named Tertullus . They pressed charges against Paul before the governor .
44024002	After the governor summoned Paul , Tertullus began to make his case against him . He declared , " Under your leadership , we have experienced substantial peace , and your administration has brought reforms to our nation .
44024003	Always and everywhere , most honorable Felix , we acknowledge this with deep gratitude .
44024004	I don’t want to take too much of your time , so I ask that you listen with your usual courtesy to our brief statement of the facts .
44024005	We have found this man to be a troublemaker who stirs up riots among all the Jews throughout the empire . He’s a ringleader of the Nazarene faction
44024006	and even tried to defile the temple . That’s when we arrested him .
44024008	By examining him yourself , you will be able to verify the allegations we are bringing against him . "
44024009	The Jews reinforced the action against Paul , affirming the truth of these accusations .
44024010	The governor nodded at Paul , giving him permission to speak . He responded , " I know that you have been judge over this nation for many years , so I gladly offer my own defense .
44024011	You can verify that I went up to worship in Jerusalem no more than twelve days ago .
44024012	They didn’t find me arguing with anyone in the temple or stirring up a crowd , whether in the synagogue or anywhere else in the city .
44024013	Nor can they prove to you the allegations they are now bringing against me .
44024014	I do admit this to you , that I am a follower of the Way , which they call a faction . Accordingly , I worship the God of our ancestors and believe everything set out in the Law and written in the Prophets .
44024015	The hope I have in God I also share with my accusers , that there will be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	On account of this , I have committed myself to maintaining a clear conscience before God and with all people .
44024017	After an absence of several years , I came to Jerusalem to bring gifts for the poor of my nation and to offer sacrifices .
44024018	When they found me in the temple , I was ritually pure . There was no crowd and no disturbance .
44024019	But there were some Jews from the province of Asia . They should be here making their accusations , if indeed they have something against me .
44024020	In their absence , have these people who are here declare what crime they found when I stood before the Jerusalem Council .
44024021	Perhaps it concerns this one statement that I blurted out when I was with them : ‘ I am on trial before you today because of the resurrection of the dead . ’ "
44024022	Felix , who had an accurate understanding of the Way , adjourned the meeting . He said , " When Lysias the commander arrives from Jerusalem , I will decide this case . "
44024023	He arranged for a centurion to guard Paul . He was to give Paul some freedom , and his friends were not to be hindered in their efforts to provide for him .
44024024	After several days , Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish , and summoned Paul . He listened to him talk about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	When he spoke about upright behavior , self-control , and the coming judgment , Felix became fearful and said , " Go away for now ! When I have time , I’ll send for you . "
44024026	At the same time , he was hoping that Paul would offer him some money , so he often sent for him and talked with him .
44024027	When two years had passed , Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus . Since Felix wanted to grant a favor to the Jews , he left Paul in prison .
44025001	Three days after arriving in the province , Festus went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	The chief priests and Jewish leaders presented their case against Paul . Appealing to him ,
44025003	they asked as a favor from Festus that he summon Paul to Jerusalem . They were planning to ambush and kill him along the way .
44025004	But Festus responded by keeping Paul in Caesarea , since he was to return there very soon himself .
44025005	" Some of your leaders can come down with me , " he said . " If he’s done anything wrong , they can bring charges against him . "
44025006	He stayed with them for no more than eight or ten days , then went down to Caesarea . The following day he took his seat in the court and ordered that Paul be brought in .
44025007	When he arrived , many Jews who had come down from Jerusalem surrounded him . They brought serious charges against him , but they couldn’t prove them .
44025008	In his own defense , Paul said , " I’ve done nothing wrong against the Jewish Law , against the temple , or against Caesar . "
44025009	Festus , wanting to put the Jews in his debt , asked Paul , " Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem to stand trial before me concerning these things ? "
44025010	Paul replied , " I’m standing before Caesar’s court . I ought to be tried here . I have done nothing wrong to the Jews , as you well know .
44025011	If I’m guilty and have done something that deserves death , then I won’t try to avoid death . But if there is nothing to their accusations against me , no one has the authority to hand me over to them . I appeal to Caesar ! "
44025012	After Festus conferred with his advisors , he responded , " You have appealed to Caesar . To Caesar you will go . "
44025013	After several days had passed , King Agrippa and Bernice arrived in Caesarea to welcome Festus .
44025014	Since they were staying there for many days , Festus discussed the case against Paul with the king . He said , " There is a man whom Felix left in prison .
44025015	When I was in Jerusalem , the Jewish chief priests and elders brought charges against him and requested a guilty verdict in his case .
44025016	I told them it is contrary to Roman practice to hand someone over before they have faced their accusers and had opportunity to offer a defense against the charges .
44025017	When they came here , I didn’t put them off . The very next day I took my seat in the court and ordered that the man be brought before me .
44025018	When the accusers took the floor , they didn’t charge him with any of the crimes I had expected .
44025019	Instead , they quibbled with him about their own religion and about some dead man named Jesus , who Paul claimed was alive .
44025020	Since I had no idea how to investigate these matters , I asked if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem to stand trial there on these issues .
44025021	However , Paul appealed that he be held in custody pending a decision from His Majesty the emperor , so I ordered that he be held until I could send him to Caesar . "
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , " I want to hear the man myself . " " Tomorrow , " Festus replied , " you will hear him . "
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great fanfare . They entered the auditorium with the military commanders and the city’s most prominent men . Festus then ordered that Paul be brought in .
44025024	Festus said , " King Agrippa and everyone present with us : You see this man ! The entire Jewish community , both here and in Jerusalem , has appealed to me concerning him . They’ve been calling for his immediate death .
44025025	I’ve found that he has done nothing deserving death . When he appealed to His Majesty , I decided to send him to Rome .
44025026	I have nothing definite to write to our lord emperor . Therefore , I’ve brought him before all of you , and especially before you , King Agrippa , so that after this investigation , I might have something to write .
44025027	After all , it would be foolish to send a prisoner without specifying the charges against him . "
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , " You may speak for yourself . " So Paul gestured with his hand and began his defense .
44026002	“ King Agrippa , I consider myself especially fortunate that I stand before you today as I offer my defense concerning all the accusations the Jews have brought against me .
44026003	This is because you understand well all the Jewish customs and controversies . Therefore , I ask you to listen to me patiently .
44026004	Every Jew knows the way of life I have followed since my youth because , from the beginning , I was among my people and in Jerusalem .
44026005	They have known me for a long time . If they wanted to , they could testify that I followed the way of life set out by the most exacting group of our religion . I am a Pharisee .
44026006	Today I am standing trial because of the hope in the promise God gave our ancestors .
44026007	This is the promise our twelve tribes hope to receive as they earnestly worship night and day . The Jews are accusing me , King Agrippa , because of this hope !
44026008	Why is it inconceivable to you that God raises the dead ?
44026009	“ I really thought that I ought to oppose the name of Jesus the Nazarene in every way possible .
44026010	And that’s exactly what I did in Jerusalem . I locked up many of God’s holy people in prison under the authority of the chief priests . When they were condemned to death , I voted against them .
44026011	In one synagogue after another — indeed , in all the synagogues — I would often torture them , compelling them to slander God . My rage bordered on the hysterical as I pursued them , even to foreign cities .
44026012	“ On one such journey , I was going to Damascus with the full authority of the chief priests .
44026013	While on the road at midday , King Agrippa , I saw a light from heaven shining around me and my traveling companions . That light was brighter than the sun .
44026014	We all fell to the ground , and I heard a voice that said to me in Aramaic , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you harassing me ? It’s hard for you to kick against a spear . ’
44026015	Then I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ The Lord replied , ‘ I am Jesus , whom you are harassing .
44026016	Get up ! Stand on your feet ! I have appeared to you for this purpose : to appoint you as my servant and witness of what you have seen and what I will show you .
44026017	I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles . I am sending you
44026018	to open their eyes . Then they can turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God , and receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are made holy by faith in me . ’
44026019	" So , King Agrippa , I wasn’t disobedient to that heavenly vision .
44026020	Instead , I proclaimed first to those in Damascus and Jerusalem , then to the whole region of Judea and to the Gentiles . My message was that they should change their hearts and lives and turn to God , and that they should demonstrate this change in their behavior .
44026021	Because of this , some Jews seized me in the temple and tried to murder me .
44026022	God has helped me up to this very day . Therefore , I stand here and bear witness to the lowly and the great . I’m saying nothing more than what the Prophets and Moses declared would happen :
44026023	that the Christ would suffer and that , as the first to rise from the dead , he would proclaim light both to my people and to the Gentiles . "
44026024	At this point in Paul’s defense , Festus declared with a loud voice , " You’ve lost your mind , Paul ! Too much learning is driving you mad ! "
44026025	But Paul replied , " I’m not mad , most honorable Festus ! I’m speaking what is sound and true .
44026026	King Agrippa knows about these things , and I have been speaking openly to him . I’m certain that none of these things have escaped his attention . This didn’t happen secretly or in some out-of-the-way place .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know you do . "
44026028	Agrippa said to Paul , " Are you trying to convince me that , in such a short time , you’ve made me a Christian ? "
44026029	Paul responded , " Whether it is a short or a long time , I pray to God that not only you but also all who are listening to me today will become like me , except for these chains . "
44026030	The king stood up , as did the governor , Bernice , and those sitting with them .
44026031	As they left , they were saying to each other , " This man is doing nothing that deserves death or imprisonment . "
44026032	Agrippa said to Festus , " This man could have been released if he hadn’t appealed to Caesar . "
44027001	When it was determined that we were to sail to Italy , Paul and some other prisoners were placed in the custody of a centurion named Julius of the Imperial Company .
44027002	We boarded a ship from Adramyttium that was about to sail for ports along the coast of the province of Asia . So we put out to sea . Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica , came with us .
44027003	The next day we landed in Sidon . Julius treated Paul kindly and permitted him to go to some friends so they could take care of him .
44027004	From there we sailed off . We passed Cyprus , using the island to shelter us from the headwinds .
44027005	We sailed across the open sea off the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia , and landed in Myra in Lycia .
44027006	There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship headed for Italy and put us on board .
44027007	After many days of slow and difficult sailing , we arrived off the coast of Cnidus . The wind wouldn’t allow us to go farther , so we sailed under the shelter of Crete off Salmone .
44027008	We sailed along the coast only with difficulty until we came to a place called Good Harbors , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	Much time had been lost , and the voyage was now dangerous since the Day of Reconciliation had already passed . Paul warned them ,
44027010	" Men , I see that our voyage will suffer damage and great loss , not only for the cargo and ship but also for our lives . "
44027011	But the centurion was persuaded more by the ship’s pilot and captain than by Paul’s advice .
44027012	Since the harbor was unsuitable for spending the winter , the majority supported a plan to put out to sea from there . They thought they might reach Phoenix in Crete and spend the winter in its harbor , which faced southwest and northwest .
44027013	When a gentle south wind began to blow , they thought they could carry out their plan . They pulled up anchor and sailed closely along the coast of Crete .
44027014	Before long , a hurricane-strength wind known as a northeaster swept down from Crete .
44027015	The ship was caught in the storm and couldn’t be turned into the wind . So we gave in to it , and it carried us along .
44027016	After sailing under the shelter of an island called Cauda , we were able to control the lifeboat only with difficulty .
44027017	They brought the lifeboat aboard , then began to wrap the ship with cables to hold it together . Fearing they might run aground on the sandbars of the Gulf of Syrtis , they lowered the anchor and let the ship be carried along .
44027018	We were so battered by the violent storm that the next day the men began throwing cargo overboard .
44027019	On the third day , they picked up the ship’s gear and hurled it into the sea .
44027020	When neither the sun nor the moon appeared for many days and the raging storm continued to pound us , all hope of our being saved from this peril faded .
44027021	For a long time no one had eaten . Paul stood up among them and said , " Men , you should have complied with my instructions not to sail from Crete . Then we would have avoided this damage and loss .
44027022	Now I urge you to be encouraged . Not one of your lives will be lost , though we will lose the ship .
44027023	Last night an angel from the God to whom I belong and whom I worship stood beside me .
44027024	The angel said , ‘ Don’t be afraid , Paul ! You must stand before Caesar ! Indeed , God has also graciously given you everyone sailing with you . ’
44027025	Be encouraged , men ! I have faith in God that it will be exactly as he told me .
44027026	However , we must run aground on some island . "
44027027	On the fourteenth night , we were being carried across the Adriatic Sea . Around midnight the sailors began to suspect that land was near .
44027028	They dropped a weighted line to take soundings and found the water to be about one hundred twenty feet deep . After proceeding a little farther , we took soundings again and found the water to be about ninety feet deep .
44027029	Afraid that we might run aground somewhere on the rocks , they hurled out four anchors from the stern and began to pray for daylight .
44027030	The sailors tried to abandon the ship by lowering the lifeboat into the sea , pretending they were going to lower anchors from the bow .
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and his soldiers , " Unless they stay in the ship , you can’t be saved from peril . "
44027032	The soldiers then cut the ropes to the lifeboat and let it drift away .
44027033	Just before daybreak , Paul urged everyone to eat . He said , " This is the fourteenth day you’ve lived in suspense , and you’ve not had even a bite to eat .
44027034	I urge you to take some food . Your health depends on it . None of you will lose a single hair from his head . "
44027035	After he said these things , he took bread , gave thanks to God in front of them all , then broke it and began to eat .
44027036	Everyone was encouraged and took some food . (
44027037	In all , there were two hundred seventy-six of us on the ship . )
44027038	When they had eaten as much as they wanted , they lightened the ship by throwing the grain into the sea .
44027039	In the morning light they saw a bay with a sandy beach . They didn’t know what land it was , but they thought they might possibly be able to run the ship aground .
44027040	They cut the anchors loose and left them in the sea . At the same time , they untied the ropes that ran back to the rudders . They raised the foresail to catch the wind and made for the beach .
44027041	But they struck a sandbar and the ship ran aground . The bow was stuck and wouldn’t move , and the stern was broken into pieces by the force of the waves .
44027042	The soldiers decided to kill the prisoners to keep them from swimming to shore and escaping .
44027043	However , the centurion wanted to save Paul , so he stopped them from carrying out their plan . He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and head for land .
44027044	He ordered the rest to grab hold of planks or debris from the ship . In this way , everyone reached land safely .
44028001	After reaching land safely , we learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The islanders showed us extraordinary kindness . Because it was rainy and cold , they built a fire and welcomed all of us .
44028003	Paul gathered a bunch of dry sticks and put them on the fire . As he did , a poisonous snake , driven out by the heat , latched on to his hand .
44028004	When the islanders saw the snake hanging from his hand , they said to each other , " This man must be a murderer ! He was rescued from the sea , but the goddess Justice hasn’t let him live ! "
44028005	Paul shook the snake into the fire and suffered no harm .
44028006	They expected him to swell up with fever or suddenly drop dead . After waiting a long time and seeing nothing unusual happen to him , they changed their minds and began to claim that he was a god .
44028007	Publius , the island’s most prominent person , owned a large estate in that area . He welcomed us warmly into his home as his guests for three days .
44028008	Publius’ father was bedridden , sick with a fever and dysentery . Paul went to see him and prayed . He placed his hand on him and healed him .
44028009	Once this happened , the rest of the sick on the island came to him and were healed .
44028010	They honored us in many ways . When we were getting ready to sail again , they supplied us with what we needed .
44028011	After three months we put out to sea in a ship that had spent the winter at the island . It was an Alexandrian ship with carvings of the twin gods Castor and Pollux as its figurehead .
44028012	We landed in Syracuse where we stayed three days .
44028013	From there we sailed to Rhegium . After one day a south wind came up , and we arrived on the second day in Puteoli .
44028014	There we found brothers and sisters who urged us to stay with them for a week . In this way we came to Rome .
44028015	When the brothers and sisters there heard about us , they came as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us . When Paul saw them , he gave thanks to God and was encouraged .
44028016	When we entered Rome , Paul was permitted to live by himself , with a soldier guarding him .
44028017	Three days later , Paul called the Jewish leaders together . When they gathered , he said , " Brothers , although I have done nothing against our people or the customs of our ancestors , I’m a prisoner from Jerusalem . They handed me over to the Romans ,
44028018	who intended to release me after they examined me , because they couldn’t find any reason for putting me to death .
44028019	When the Jews objected , I was forced to appeal to Caesar . Don’t think I appealed to Caesar because I had any reason to bring charges against my nation .
44028020	This is why I asked to see you and speak with you : it’s because of the hope of Israel that I am bound with this chain . "
44028021	They responded , " We haven’t received any letters about you from Judea , nor have any of our brothers come and reported or said anything bad about you .
44028022	But we think it’s important to hear what you think , for we know that people everywhere are speaking against this faction . "
44028023	On the day scheduled for this purpose , many people came to the place where he was staying . From morning until evening , he explained and testified concerning God’s kingdom and tried to convince them about Jesus through appealing to the Law from Moses and the Prophets .
44028024	Some were persuaded by what he said , but others refused to believe .
44028025	They disagreed with each other and were starting to leave when Paul made one more statement : “ The Holy Spirit spoke correctly when he said to your ancestors through Isaiah the prophet ,
44028026	Go to this people and say : You will hear , to be sure , but never understand ; and you will certainly see but never recognize what you are seeing .
44028027	This people’s senses have become calloused , and they’ve become hard of hearing , and they’ve shut their eyes
44028028	" Therefore , be certain of this : God’s salvation has been sent to the Gentiles . They will listen ! "
44028030	Paul lived in his own rented quarters for two full years and welcomed everyone who came to see him .
44028031	Unhindered and with complete confidence , he continued to preach God’s kingdom and to teach about the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001001	From Paul , a slave of Christ Jesus , called to be an apostle and set apart for God’s good news .
45001002	
45001003	God promised this good news about his Son ahead of time through his prophets in the holy scriptures . His Son was descended from David .
45001004	He was publicly identified as God’s Son with power through his resurrection from the dead , which was based on the Spirit of holiness . This Son is Jesus Christ our Lord .
45001005	Through him we have received God’s grace and our appointment to be apostles . This was to bring all Gentiles to faithful obedience for his name’s sake .
45001006	You who are called by Jesus Christ are also included among these Gentiles .
45001007	To those in Rome who are dearly loved by God and called to be God’s people . Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
